title.native: マギ シンドバッドの冒険

description:
Fifteen years before the events of Magi, a brave and handsome young man named Sinbad set sail and started his adventure. The future High King of Seven Seas gradually matured through various encounters and farewells, taking him towards kingship step by step.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Economics
tags.description: Centers around the field of economics.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

__[Profile](http://barnstorm-design-labo.com/member/miyao.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sbs_miyao)__ __Yoshikazu Miyao__ is a Japanese director, mechanical designer, episode director and storyboard artist. He currently works for studio Gonzo, and is affiliated with [Barnstorm Design Labo](https://anilist.co/staff/146502/Barnstorm-Design-Labo).

__[Artist Profile (takumi-project)](http://www.takumi-project.com/artisan/tomohiro-okubo.html)__

__Birthplace:__ Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Favorite Artist:__ The Beatles

__Tomohiro Ookubo__ is a Japaense musician, composer, arranger and lyricist.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

__[Website](https://www.fujifabric.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fujifabric_info) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/fujifabric) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/fujifabricSMEJ)__

__Formed:__ 2000

__Biography:__
Fujifabric was initially formed by Masahiko Shimura in the early 2000s and consisted of five members. They released their first mini album in 2002 titled _A la carte_, and later made their major debut with "Sakura no Kisetsu" through record label EMI Music Japan (known as Toshiba EMI at the time) on April 14, 2004. 

After being active for 9 years, the band would go through a sudden change when Shimura died at the age of 29 on December 24, 2009. At the time the band consisted of four members, Masahiko Shimura, a vocalist and guitarist, Souichirou Yamauchi, a guitarist, Daisuke Kanazawa, a keyboardist, and Shinichi Katou, a bassist. The remaining members decided to continue band activities as a three-piece band, with Souichirou taking over as the vocalist.

__Members:__
- Souichirou Yamauchi (山内総一郎) – vocalist and guitarist
- [Daisuke Kanazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/209456/Daisuke-Kanazawa) (金澤ダイスケ) – keyboardist, lyricist and composer
- Shinichi Katou (加藤慎一) – bassist

__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative Rock), Anison

__[Website](http://www.penguinresearch.jp/) | [Profile (SonyMusic)](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/penguinresearch/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZPSPAvxS6Kb_gLe_HYi94g)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PGR_info)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4jiOvoNgxnEvdlBwrx6o28)__

__Biography:__
PENGUIN RESEARCH, alternatively abbreviated PGR, is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record labels ultraCeep (2016–), SME Records (2016–) and Sacra Music (2017–). They made their major debut in 2016 with the release of their first full single titled "[Joker ni Yoroshiku](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SnoDBlVBLh4)", which initially aired as an ending in [Durararax2 Ketsu](https://anilist.co/anime/20880/Durararax2-Ketsu/).

__Members:__
- [Youji Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/153560/) (生田鷹司) – vocalist
- [Shouta Horie](https://anilist.co/staff/156564) (堀江晶太) – bass guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [John Kanda](https://anilist.co/staff/160031) (神田ジョン) – guitarist
- [Keita Shinbo](https://twitter.com/KeitaShinbo_PGR) (新保恵大) – drummer
- [Yosuke Shibazaki](https://twitter.com/yosuke_pgr) (柴﨑洋輔) – keyboardist
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
Hyeon-Dae Song is a Korean photographer and director of photography affiliated with T2 Studio.
Kazuaki Ishibashi is a magazine editor currently affiliated with Shounen Sunday.
